TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Locale : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Lang.ICloneable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Locale extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Lang.ICloneable, class System.IDisposable
type Locale = class inherit Object interface ISerializable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable interface ICloneable

Docs.summary: Locale represents a language/country/variant combination.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string language) cil managed

Docs.param: An ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code, or a language subtag up to 8 characters in length. See the Locale class description about valid language values.
Docs.summary: Construct a locale from a language code.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string language, string country) cil managed

Docs.param: An ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code, or a language subtag up to 8 characters in length. See the Locale class description about valid language values.
An ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or a UN M.49 numeric-3 area code. See the Locale class description about valid country values.
Docs.summary: Construct a locale from language and country.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public Locale (string language, string country, string variant);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string language, string country, string variant) cil managed
new Java.Util.Locale : string * string * string -> Java.Util.Locale

Docs.param: An ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code, or a language subtag up to 8 characters in length. See the Locale class description about valid language values.
An ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or a UN M.49 numeric-3 area code. See the Locale class description about valid country values.
Any arbitrary value used to indicate a variation of a Locale. See the Locale class description for the details.
Docs.summary: Construct a locale from language, country and variant.

Docs.summary: Returns a list of matching Locale instances using the filtering mechanism defined in RFC 4647.
Docs.returns: a list of Locale instances for matching language tags sorted in descending order based on priority or weight, or an empty list if nothing matches. The list is modifiable.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary:
Returns a string representation of this Locale object, consisting of language, country, variant, script, and extensions as below:
language + "_" + country + "_" + (variant + "_#" | "#") + script + "-" + extensions
Language is always lower case, country is always upper case, script is always title case, and extensions are always lower case.
Docs.returns: A string representation of the Locale, for debugging.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
